name: How to update spinnaker Github Tokens.txt - Github token or hal config token.
description: This section explains the process of updating the GitHub token used by Spinnaker, a continuous delivery platform, to access GitHub repositories. It involves creating a new GitHub token with the required permissions, updating the token in a secure credential store, and restarting the Spinnaker components to load the new token. The instructions cover two types of tokens: one for general GitHub access and another for a specific GitHub integration called Spin Sleeve.
use_cases: Updating the GitHub token used by Spinnaker for accessing repositories
Securing the GitHub token in a credential store
Restarting Spinnaker components to load the new token

name: How to update spinnaker Github Tokens.txt - Spin Sleeve token.
description: This section explains how to update the GitHub token used by Spinnaker, a continuous delivery platform, to authenticate with GitHub repositories. It provides step-by-step instructions for editing the 'spin-sleeve' secret in a Kubernetes cluster, where the GitHub token is stored in base64 encoded format. After updating the token, the Spinnaker pods need to be restarted to apply the changes.
use_cases: Updating GitHub authentication token for Spinnaker
Rotating GitHub token for security purposes
Configuring Spinnaker to access private GitHub repositories
capabilities: Configuring Spinnaker in a Kubernetes environment
